build_chart.description: No height/weight build chart is provided in this guide; underwriting is based entirely on medical and non‐medical issue criteria.

medical_conditions.description: Each medical condition is mapped to a set of UHL/UFFL products (GIWL, EIWL, Deluxe Term, Deluxe, Premier Term, Provider). "Y" indicates acceptance (with possible rating), "N" indicates decline. "Y‐Maybe" indicates possible preferred consideration.

laboratory_requirements.description: No blood, urine, or paramedical exams are specified—underwriting decisions are made solely from the condition tables above (fully simplified disease model).

risk_classes.description: Each UHL/UFFL product code (GIWL, EIWL, Deluxe Term, Deluxe, Premier Term, Provider) serves as a 'risk class.' Acceptance is condition- and time-frame–driven per product.

classes.name: GIWL (Guaranteed Issue Whole Life)
criteria: Most conditions accepted (Y) regardless of timeframe, except those specifically declined (e.g., AIDS/HIV, Alzheimer's, Dementia, Terminal illness).
No build chart or lab tests required—guaranteed issue subject to disease questions only.

classes.name: EIWL (Express Issue Whole Life)
criteria: Most conditions accepted if treated >12 months ago; recent events (<12 months) may be declined or require GIWL instead.
Certain conditions (e.g., ALS) accepted only with "Maybe Preferred" consideration.

classes.name: Deluxe Term
criteria: Conditions accepted if treated >2 years ago (Y in that column); recent events (<2 years) result in decline.
Mild controlled conditions (e.g., well‐controlled diabetes, mild asthma) are allowed.

classes.name: Deluxe (Permanent)
criteria: Most conditions accepted if treated >2 years ago; some accepted at >5 years (Y in that column).
Mild conditions (e.g., controlled hypertension, mild asthma) accepted.

classes.name: Premier Term
criteria: Only applicants with no significant disease history (all "Y" in >5 years column) or controlled benign conditions are accepted.
No acceptance for most conditions except those with "Y" in the >5 years column.

classes.name: Provider (Preferred Whole Life)
criteria: Only a very narrow set of conditions accepted (e.g., mild asthma, well‐controlled diabetes without complications, mild hyperlipidemia) marked "Y" in the >5 years or "Y (Maybe Pref'd)" column.
All other conditions result in decline or downgraded product.

tobacco_guidelines.description: No explicit tobacco table is given (nicotine is treated as a medical condition under "Nicotine use"), but DUI, felony, hazardous sports, and other non‐medical issues appear below.

financial_underwriting.description: Not addressed in this guide (final expense and simplified‐issue focus). No income multiples or financial docs required.

special_considerations.description: Non‐medical issue factors (e.g., DUI, felony conviction, hazardous sports/aviation, declined within past years) determine product eligibility or decline.

factors.guideline: Accepted for GIWL, EIWL, Deluxe Term, and Deluxe; declined for Premier Term and Provider.
Accepted for GIWL, EIWL, Deluxe Term, Deluxe, and Premier Term; declined for Provider.
Accepted for GIWL, EIWL, Deluxe Term, and Deluxe; declined for Premier Term and Provider.
Accepted for all products, including Provider (Provider may consider as "Maybe Preferred").

factors.factor: Felony conviction or on parole for felony within 7 years
factors.guideline: Accepted for GIWL and EIWL; declined for all other products.

factors.factor: Felony conviction or on parole for felony >7 years, <10 years
factors.guideline: Accepted for GIWL, EIWL, Deluxe Term, and Deluxe; declined for Premier Term and Provider.

factors.factor: Felony conviction or on parole for felony >10 years
